p: Tannins are a class of phenolic compounds of great complexity and importance. They are classified, according to their chemical structure, into two groups: hydrolyzable and condensed [ 77]. Gallic acid is a benzoic acid, derived from cinnamic acid, derived from the shikimate pathway. Gallic acid reacts with ureadin diphosphate-glucose (UDP-glucose), forming the intermediate Î²-glycocalin, which gives rise to 1,2,3,4,6-pentagaloyl- d-glucose, a molecule that, after oxidative transformations, leads to the formation of galotanins and ellagitannins [ 74].
